column1: Hollola is a municipality of Finland
column2: located in the Päijänne Tavastia region.  The municipality is unilingually Finnish and has a population of 23
column3: 428 (31 July 2020) and covers an area of 727.47 square kilometres (280.88 sq mi) of which 68.66 km2 (26.51 sq mi) is water. The population density is 50.58 inhabitants per square kilometre (131.0/sq mi).

column1: Hollola has the tallest structure in Finland
A popular resort in Hollola is Messilä. There you can do cross-country-skiing
column3: tramping and play golf. There is a hotel and a camping site in Messilä. Messilä is located by Vesijärvi.

column2: Hollola hosted the Jukola Relays. This Orienteering event is a night relay
column3: and one of the most popular orienteering events in the world by number of competitors.
